intro: Bonafousia prancei, commonly known as the Prance's bonafousia, is a rare and specialized flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant is distinguished by its unique floral morphology, featuring vibrant yellow petals and a dense central cluster of tiny florets. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils with minimal water availability. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Bonafousia prancei is considered a species of conservation concern.
